rooms.Name: Desert Trail
rooms.Description:
You find yourself on some sort of a path in the desert.  It looks as though
it has been traveled recently.  After close examination, you see what might
possibly be ruts in the sand from wagon wheels.

Exits.Description: You see an expanse of desert.

rooms.Name: Desert Trail
rooms.Description:
You're on a trail leading north and south.  Your feet are burning from the
hot sand, your hair is 3 shades lighter, and you hope you find water soon.

rooms.Name: Desert Lane
rooms.Description:
The trail seems to widen considerably here.  Your hopes soar.  You begin to
dream of soaking your blistered feet in a cool fountain.

rooms.Name: Desert Lane
rooms.Description:
This desert is really getting to your nerve endings.  But looking at down at
the sand, you realize the ruts were definitely made from wagon wheels.  There
are also camel prints in the sand here.

rooms.Name: A Sandy Road
rooms.Description:
The lane bends to the east here, and has widened into a road. You see a
few cacti growing here and stop to admire their brightly colored flowers.
Overlooking this bend here is a small rock outcropping.

ExtraDescs.Description: They have beautiful pink, blue, and yellow blossoms.

rooms.Name: A Sandy Road
rooms.Description:
You are on a frequently-traveled road of sand.  To the east, you think you
see smoke rising from somewhere off in the distance.

rooms.Name: A Sandy Road
rooms.Description:
You are on a sandy road leading east and west.  To the east, smoke curls up
into the sky lazily, and you think you see buildings off in the distance.

rooms.Name: A Sandy Road
rooms.Description:
You are standing on a sandy road just outside of a very large gate.  Beyond
the gate, you see a village.  You made it!  You hope they are friendly..

rooms.Name: The Great Gates of Agrabah
rooms.Description:
You find yourself staring up at two massive iron gates that must tower thirty
feet into the air.  They seem to be the only entrance to this city, as they
are firmly placed between what looks to be sixty-foot walls ensconced with very
nasty looking daggers around the entire perimeter of the city.  After the
grueling trek through the desert, you hope to have the strength to open them.

ExtraDescs.Description: The massive gates look to be made of solid iron, and very impenetrable.

rooms.Name: Inside the Great Gates
rooms.Description:
You are just inside the massive gates of Agrabah.  From here, you hear the
bustling of busy merchants and citizens of Agrabah going about their daily
business. The road continues east into the city.

ExtraDescs.Description: The massive gates look to be made of solid iron, and very impenetrable.

rooms.Name: West Camel Walk
rooms.Description:
You are on what looks to be the main drag through the city.  Shops and
townspeople are everywhere, and your nostrils are assaulted with a multitude
of foods and incenses.

rooms.Name: West Camel Walk
rooms.Description: You are on the main drag through the city.  The road continues east and west.

rooms.Name: West Camel Walk
rooms.Description: You are on the main drag through the city.  The road continues east and west.

rooms.Name: West Camel Walk
rooms.Description: You are on the main drag through the city.  The road continues east and west.

rooms.Name: The Central Square
rooms.Description:
You are in a huge square, in the middle of which stands a shimmering fountain.
It looks to be the center of town.  Merchants bustle everywhere and everyone
looks too busy to talk.  There are exits in every direction.

rooms.Name: East Camel Walk
rooms.Description: You are on the main drag through town.  The road continues east and west.

rooms.Name: East Camel Walk
rooms.Description: You are on the main drag through town.  The road continues east and west.

rooms.Name: East Camel Walk
rooms.Description: You are on the main drag through town.  The road continues east and west.

rooms.Name: East end of Camel Walk
rooms.Description: You are at the east end of the main drag through town.

rooms.Name: Palace Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a walk made of sandstone leading north and south through town.

rooms.Name: Palace Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a walk made of sandstone leading north and south through town.

rooms.Name: The Palace Square
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the center of a huge sqare filled with bustling merchants
and citizens of the community.  The entire sandstone floor of this square is
a brightly painted Royal coat-of-arms.  The smell of sugar-dates, figs, and
pistachios are strong here, and judging from the apparel of the people, it
looks like you are in the more well-to-do part of town.

rooms.Name: The Temple of Agrabah
rooms.Description:
You are in the Temple of Agrabah, city of mystery...of enchantment.  There
are murals covering the walls and ceilings that depict the evolution of man,
and a few statues along the walls.  This is a quiet, peaceful place just for
sitting for an hour or so of solemn meditation.

rooms.Name: Palace Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a white stone walkway that runs north and south.

rooms.Name: Palace Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a white stone walkway that runs north and south.

rooms.Name: Palace Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a white stone walkway that runs north and south.

rooms.Name: Palace Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a white stone walkway that runs north and south.

rooms.Name: Palace Walk
rooms.Description: You are at the northern end of a white stone walkway.

rooms.Name: Before The Sultans Palace
rooms.Description:
You are standing before the steps to the Sultans Palace.  Looking up to the 
top of them you gaze upon a wonderous palace of white, with many gold-guilded
towers rising up into the blue sky.  At the top, two Royal Guards stand at
attention before the doors to the palace.

rooms.Name: Cart Alley
rooms.Description:
You are in a dark alley that runs north and south through the city.
This seems to be a shabbier part of town judging by the condition of the 
buildings around you, and the tattered clothes of the townsfolk.

rooms.Name: Cart Alley
rooms.Description:
You are in a dark alley that runs north and south through the city.
This seems to be a shabbier part of town judging by the condition of the
buildings around you, and the tattered clothes of the townsfolk.

rooms.Name: Peddlers Square
rooms.Description:
You are in what appears to be the center of the poor man's marketplace.  There
are peddlers, thieves, and cunning merchants all around you.  You tighten your
hold on your money pouch and remove your jewelry, just to be on the safe side.

rooms.Name: West Cart Row
rooms.Description:
You are on the western half of a dirty street in the shady part of town.
Some of these folks are the types you wouldn't want to meet in a dark alley.

rooms.Name: West Cart Row
rooms.Description:
You are on the western half of a dirty street in a shady part of town.
Some of these folks are the types you wouldn't want to meet in a dark alley.

rooms.Name: West Cart Row
rooms.Description:
You are on the western half of a dirty street in the shady part of town.
Some of these folks are the types you wouldn't want to meet in a dark alley.

rooms.Name: The Dump
rooms.Description:
You are in the smelliest place in town - only the smells that assault your
nostrils are not the delicious ones that waft down from the rest of the town.
The place is crawling with rats, cockroaches, maggots, and filled with smelly
garbage. You decide to exit quickly before you lose your last meager meal.

rooms.Name: East Cart Row
rooms.Description:
You are on the eastern part of a dirty street in the shady part of town.
Some of these folks are the types you wouldn't want to meet in a dark alley.

rooms.Name: East Cart Row
rooms.Description:
You are on the eastern part of a dirty street in the shady part of town.
Some of these folks are the types you wouldn't want to meet in a dark alley.

rooms.Name: East Cart Row
rooms.Description:
You are on the eastern part of a dirty street in the shady part of town.
Some of these folks are the types you wouldn't want to meet in a dark alley.

rooms.Name: East End of Cart Row
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the east end of Cart Row.  An old ramshackle building
blocks your way east.  The only way to go other than back the way you came is
up into the building.  There seem to be "Condemned" signs all over it though..

ExtraDescs.Description: The building is barely standing and looks extremely dangerous!

rooms.Name: West Sultans Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a sandstone sidewalk that runs east and west.

rooms.Name: West Sultans Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a sandstone sidewalk that runs east and west.

rooms.Name: West Sultans Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a sandstone sidewalk that runs east and west.

rooms.Name: The Sand Box
rooms.Description:
You are in an extremely large sand pit just off the west end of Sultans Walk.
Apparently this is where the children of the town come to build sandcastles
and stage fake battles against fake opposing forces.

rooms.Name: East Sultans Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a sandstone sidewalk that runs east and west.

rooms.Name: East Sultans Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a sandstone sidewalk that runs east and west.

rooms.Name: East Sultans Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a sandstone sidewalk that runs east and west.

rooms.Name: East End of Sultans Walk
rooms.Description: You are on a sandstone sidewalk that runs east and west.

rooms.Name: Don't Look Down
rooms.Description:
Since taking the stairs is rather like an obstacle course, you opt to climb
the ladder to get up here instead and avoid something falling down onto your
head. Since the ladder is an old one, you decide to move on - and fast.

rooms.Name: Aladdins Humble Abode
rooms.Description:
This place looks familiar.  Now you know where you are!  This was where our
beloved Aladdin retired every night after a long day of survival on the city
streets. Its definitely a safe enough haven - very few others would venture
into a building such as this.  Looking out the window with its tattered curtain
blowing gently in the breeze, your eyes rest on a breathtaking view of the city
below you, and the Sultans Palace just beyond.  The view from this room is the
best in the city.  Now you know why Aladdin chose it.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Thieves Guild
rooms.Description: You are standing in the entrance to the Thieves guild.

rooms.Name: Gazeem's Second Hand Shop
rooms.Description:
This second-hand shop is filled to the rafters with every type of odd-and-end
imaginable. Gazeem's wife got so mad at him for hoarding this junk in their
home she threw it all into the street - and him, also.  She finally let him
back into the house after he rented this small shop.  You wonder, given the
nature of Gazeem, who is a well-known thief - and also has many rather shady
dealings with Jafar, the Sultans Royal Vizier - just where it was all obtained.

rooms.Name: Rahul's Used Rugs
rooms.Description:
Being that sand ruins many a good rug (as any vacuum cleaner salesman will
tell you), Rahul is here to sell you a good (cough) used one.  Although some
are rather faded, and some are threadbare in places, he must make a living too.

rooms.Name: Ahkim's Leather Goods
rooms.Description:
This is Ahkim's shop of leather goods.  His workmanship is excellent and his
prices are small in comparison to what he could charge on the north side of
town. Being the humble man that he is, he retains this shop on the poor side
of town as an everyday reminder of his own mortality.

rooms.Name: Ali's Rent-A-Harem
rooms.Description:
This is where the desperate man may come to rent himself a little, shall we
say, compromising company.  The girls aren't always what they should be, but
hey, what do you expect for such short notice?

rooms.Name: Fouad's Used Camel Sales
rooms.Description:
This is where Fouad, son of Ahkmed, may he rest in peace, goes about his
daily business of selling used camels.  When buy a camel from Fouad, always
remember: the camel that moves when poked with a stick is still alive.

rooms.Name: Abdul's Water Shoppe
rooms.Description:
This is a small but clean little shop, with neatly arranged shelves upon
which are several sizes and varieties of canteens, flasks, and waterskins.
Stacked neatly against one wall are rows of water barrels.  Abdul, the
proprietor, almost died from drinking contaminated water at an oasis not far
from town a few years ago, and the experience so frightened him that he
promptly opened this shop with hopes of preventing that sort of thing from
happening to anyone else.  The water is pure, and the prices low.

rooms.Name: The Post Office
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the Post Office of Agrabah.  There are piles of neatly
sorted mail on the counters, and several crates stacked against the walls
that have been pryed open by curious customs officials.  WANTED posters dot
the walls around the entire room - funny, didn't you just see that guy?

ExtraDescs.Description: English very good not much to tourist.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Clerics Guild
rooms.Description: You are in the entrance to the Clerics guild.

rooms.Name: Shakka's Musical Instruments
rooms.Description:
Now this is a shop you didn't expect to find.  What an assortment!  There
must be instruments here from all over the world.  Shakka attempts to hide
an amused smile, then turns back to her dusting, allowing you to browse.  On
every wall there are instruments of every size and shape.  Some look like
gourds that you grew in your garden once.  Your eyes fall on a beautiful gold
Harp that sits in the corner.  Oh how you wish you knew how to play it.

rooms.Name: Khazil's Armory
rooms.Description:
You have found your way to Khazil's place - a shop filled with helmets, armors
of every type, size, and description, and shields propped against every wall.
Maybe you would like to buy some armor here, being in a strange town and all..

rooms.Name: Majiq's Potion Shoppe
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a shop comprised of nothing but vials and bottles of
many colorful descriptions.  The proprietor, Majiq, keeps a watchful eye as
you browse through the many shelves in wonder.  What in the name of Allah do
you suppose all these potions could be for?

rooms.Name: Entrance to Mages Guild
rooms.Description: You are in the entrance to the Mages guild.

rooms.Name: Rabul's Camel Cafe
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in a busy and slightly cluttered roadside Cafe.  The smells
of coffee and pastries are wonderful in here.  Rabul buys his pastries from
Rajiv fresh every morning.  Well..he says he does.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Warriors Guild
rooms.Description: You are standing in the entrance to the warriors guild.

rooms.Name: Ahmed's Tailor Shop
rooms.Description:
Ahmed is the town tailor.  He was forced to learn how to stitch when his
daughter accidently dropped a vase that she and his wife were carrying, and
2 of his wife's fingers were severed by a large shard.  But all being well
that ends well, it turns out he became an excellent tailor, and makes a good
living for his family.  He is now the best dressed merchant in town.

rooms.Name: Brahim's Weapons Shop
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in an entire room full of every kind of weapon imaginable.
There are gigantic knives and lances on the walls, and the room is lined with
wooden display cases full of guns, knives, daggers, and a multitude of various
other weaponry.  Brahim himself has crafted many of them - others are imported
from around the world.  You shiver as your gaze falls upon a giant bastard
sword hanging from the ceiling.  Good thing you aren't another foot taller..

rooms.Name: Haslam's General Store
rooms.Description:
This is the general store of Agrabah.  It is here that most of the local
folk buy their miscellaneous items.  Haslam is a burly native with a sharp
eye for shoplifters and very little to say to outsiders.  The shelves are
full of items for almost every need, and there are barrels, baskets and boxes
of surplus supplies stacked along the walls.

rooms.Name: Rajiv's Bakery
rooms.Description:
Rajiv is the town baker, and an excellent one at that.  The heavenly smells
of danish pastries, doughnuts, breads, and scores of other freshly baked goods
makes your stomach growl with hunger.  Rajiv nods at you in greeting as you
enter, then silently observes you while you browse.

rooms.Name: Raslim's Butchery
rooms.Description:
Here is the only place in town where you can buy meats and poultry.  Most are
cuts of camel that Raslim buys from Fouad, the used camel salesman, however
sometimes he gets imported meats such as beef and lamb.  Another favorite,
dogmeat, is available here.

rooms.Name: Merhlin's Magick Shoppe
rooms.Description:
You find yourself standing in the center of a shoppe filled with all types of
magickal items.  Judging from the threadbare rugs on the floor, it is a
popular shop in this city.  You see a variety of lamps on the shelves, and
wonder if one might be.....nah.  As you look at the colorful assortment of
lamps, scrolls, and other various items, you feel rather insecure in your own
ineptness with magick.  This stuff looks powerful!

rooms.Name: Khazim's Jewelry Stand
rooms.Description:
You are standing in front of a smell, tent-covered booth bearing a
not-so-straightly hung wooden sign on which is painted in fading red paint,
Khazim's Discount Jewelry.  On the wooden counter there are several wooden
ring cases, in which there are an assortment of rings that range from diamond
to brass.  Behind the counter, hung on small brown pegs, is a large assortment
of necklaces and bracelets, ranging equally in their value and appearance.
You wonder how much of this "discount jewelry" was actually acquired honestly.

rooms.Name: Reception
rooms.Description:
This is where you may rent your possessions until you return - for a small
fee of course.  Hesthra sits behind the desk trying to determine how much
gold she can squeeze out of your money pouch.

rooms.Name: The Cryogenic Center
rooms.Description:
Tanbami smiles at you as you walk in the door.  This center is for more
long term rentals - if you plan on taking a long trip, the rates are much
cheaper here than renting by day.

rooms.Name: Hestrim's Fruit Stand
rooms.Description:
You find yourself standing in a small fruit stand.  There are several baskets
of apples and oranges, some boxes of imported bananas, and even some fresh
strawberries. Ok, maybe not so fresh - but you are in the desert.  Hestrim
is very young for a merchant here, he inherited the stand rather suddenly when
his father, Ragba, died of exposure while lost in the desert last year.  He is
new at this business, but is showing potential.  Next year he may try to
import some of those exotic fruits from Ceylon.

rooms.Name: Mesra's Date Stand
rooms.Description:
You are in a small stand shielded from the sun by a tent cover.  Around you
are baskets full of freshly picked dates for your dinner table.  Mesra lost
her husband to a scorpion bite two years ago, and has since been making a
meager income for her family by taking over her husband's date stand.

rooms.Name: Hagul's Figs
rooms.Description:
You find yourself surrounded by barrels and baskets full of fresh figs.  Hagul
had a fig tree growing in his yard that dropped so many figs that his family
couldn't walk in it without stepping on them.  His wife, angry that she could
not keep her floors clean of sticky figs, made him pick them all up.  Having a
head for business, Hagul then opened this fig stand, solving the problems with
both his yard and wife, and making money to boot.

rooms.Name: Tamin's Pistachio Stand
rooms.Description:
You have found the only pistachio stand in town.  Tamin stands here in white
tunic and turban, ready to sell you fresh pistachios for your table.

rooms.Name: Crazy Hakico's Discount Fertilizer
rooms.Description:
You find yourself staring at an old, broken down wagon, that has the sign:
Crazy Hakico's Discount Fertilizer painted on it in faded red letters.
Judging from the smell, that is exactly what the man sells.  Hakico is the
neighbor of Fouad, Agrabah's used camel merchant.  This may explain how his
(thriving?) business came to be.  You thank the man, but say "no thanks".

rooms.Name: Fouad's Used Camel Sales
rooms.Description:
This is where Fouad, son of Ahkmed, may he rest in peace, goes about his
daily business of selling used camels.  When buy a camel from Fouad, always
remember: the camel that moves when poked with a stick is still alive.

rooms.Name: Used Camels
rooms.Description: This is the shop room for shop 22580.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Paladins Guild
rooms.Description: You are standing in the entrance to the Paladins guild.

rooms.Name: The Paladins Inner Sanctum
rooms.Description:
You are in a small well-lit room, with very few furnishings.  The walls are
adorned with ornate paintings, and a huge holy shield with a huge cross
engraved on it takes up the best part of one whole wall.

rooms.Name: Entrance to Antipaladins Guild
rooms.Description: You are standing in the entrance to the Antipaladins guild.

rooms.Name: Rakul's Thieves Guild.
rooms.Description:
This is where the thieves and pickpockets of the city come to get the best of
training from the best of Masters.  Rakul is a lean, wiry man with leathery
skin and a glint in his eyes.  He will have your money pouch without even
appearing to come within three feet of you.  He trains only those with talent
and tosses the rest back onto the street to fend for themselves.

rooms.Name: Ramin's Clerics Guild
rooms.Description:
You find yourself standing in a large, immaculate room that is mostly bare
except for a few pads on the floor and two very soft-looking overstuffed
chairs that sit facing each other.  There are beautiful paintings on the walls
here, and you wonder who the artist was.  In one corner sits a small, simple
altar under a large wooden crucifix.  The room is all white, and the imported
persian carpet depicts scenes of angels.  You suddenly feel very humble.

rooms.Name: Ahman's Mages Guild
rooms.Description:
You are standing in a small, dark shop just off the main drag.  The proprietor,
Ahman, stands before you in dark purple garb and turban, looking deceptively
amiable. The room is cluttered with various flasks and scrolls.  Looking at
the rug askew on the floor, you think you see part of a pentogram painted on
the floor.  Ahman, a master sorcerer and not one to be trifled with, must
train his apprentices here.

rooms.Name: Abul's Warriors Guild
rooms.Description:
You are in a large room with bits and pieces of armor and weaponry scattered
about. There are straw practice mats about, and several large areas that
look to be practice arenas.  Abul has been guildmaster here for many years,
and this is where he trains his apprentices.  Since by the look of him, he
could rip your head off with one arm, you decide to be very nice to him.

rooms.Name: The Reading Room
rooms.Description:
This is a warm, clean and cozy room with comfortable chairs and a few tables
along the walls, each with a soft candle burning on it for reading.
